item.title: Dumped trailer, 22nd September
item.description:

item.title: States the problem has been fixed when it clearly hasn’t., 22nd September
item.description:
Southwark Council continues to practice dishonesty. This issue was reported on 21/09/25 and it states the fly tipping has been fixed , clearly it has not . Please attend to this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New zebra crossing, 22nd September
item.description:
The crossing is too long and needs a middle bit back to how it was before as many cars are not stopping or only one side stops and the cars on the other side keep moving I complained as soon as it was put in its extremely dangerous and many people have had problems trying to cross safely Also the stupid bike bit that's separate its also dangerous especially at night Please can someone come and resolve these issues by putting in traffic lights or making a area in the middle like it was before Get someone to try crossing at night and during the day If you can not help me with this issue please advise me who can as this is a urgent matter that needs addressing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edwards Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipped Mattress NOT FiXED Garland Court, Wansey St, 22nd September
item.description:
Flytipped Mattress NOT FiXED at Garland Court, Wansey St. The Mattress has been pushed off the pavement and is obstructing the entrance gate to flats 24-31 Garland Court (Orange stripped Building) Wansey St. This is now a fire and health and safety hazard please remove it as quickly as possible. It is very difficult to gain entry and exit as the mattress is blocking the gate - see new photo.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wansey Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
